com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.itemmanipulation.swipedismiss

Class SwipeDismissAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.BaseAdapterDecorator
        • com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.itemmanipulation.swipedismiss.SwipeDismissAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SectionIndexer, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter, com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.util.ListViewWrapperSetter, com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.util.Swappable

    public class SwipeDismissAdapter
extends com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.BaseAdapterDecorator
    Adds an option to swipe items in an AbsListView away. Do not call View.setOnTouchListener(android.view.View.OnTouchListener) on your AbsListView!

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface android.widget.Adapter

        IGNORE_ITEM_VIEW_TYPE, NO_SELECTION

      • setParentIsHorizontalScrollContainer

        public void setParentIsHorizontalScrollContainer()
        If the adapter's AbsListView is hosted inside a parent(/grand-parent/etc) that can scroll horizontally, horizontal swipes won't work, because the parent will prevent touch-events from reaching the AbsListView.

        Call this method to fix this behavior. Note that this will prevent the parent from scrolling horizontally when the user touches anywhere in a list item.

      • setSwipeTouchChildResId

        public void setSwipeTouchChildResId(int childResId)
        If the adapter's AbsListView is hosted inside a parent(/grand-parent/etc) that can scroll horizontally, horizontal swipes won't work, because the parent will prevent touch events from reaching the AbsListView.

        If a AbsListView view has a child with the given resource id, the user can still swipe the list item by touching that child. If the user touches an area outside that child (but inside the list item view), then the swipe will not happen and the parent will do its job instead (scrolling horizontally).

        Parameters:
        childResId - The resource id of the list items' child that the user should touch to be able to swipe the list items.

      • dismiss

        public void dismiss(int position)
        Dismisses the View corresponding to given position. Calling this method has the same effect as manually swiping an item off the screen.
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the item in the ListAdapter.

      • getDismissTouchListener

        public SwipeDismissTouchListener getDismissTouchListener()
        Returns the SwipeDismissTouchListener that is used by this SwipeDismissAdapter.
        Returns:
        null if setListViewWrapper(com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.util.ListViewWrapper) has not been called yet.

      • notifyDataSetChanged

        public void notifyDataSetChanged()
        Overrides:
        notifyDataSetChanged in class com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.BaseAdapterDecorator
